text: The Clarity Act (known as Bill C-20 before it became law) was a law passed by Canadian Government in 1999. == Other websites == * Text of the Clarity Act * Full text of the Reference re Secession of Quebec * 1995 Act Respecting the Future of Quebec * Open letter in support of the democratic right to self- determination for Quebec *Debates - Issue 44 - April 6, 2000 (Senate's Second Reading debate about the passage of specific powers to the House of Commons; notable because the Senate is a co-equal body) * CBC report on introduction of Clarity Bill Category:Canadian legislation Category:1999 in Canada Category:1990s in law
title: Clarity Act
